TI_TEXT.P: Sistema di magazzinaggio a mezzo container

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.ADDRESS: EDF EN France Coeur Défense Tour B- 100 esplanade du Général de Gaulle

TITLE.P: Toucan II — Energy Storage Pland and Power Conversion system

SHORT_DESCR.P: The scope of works concerns the design, material procurement, construction and commissioning work, and also operation and maintenance for a stationary energy storage power system, PV inverters and PPC included in a general electricity plant, combining storage and photovoltaic panels.
The Project Toucan 2 power plant is located in French Guyana and will be composed of:
— a 5MWp PV power plant,
— one MV substation,

— a energy storage power plant whose size is to be proposed by the Contractor keeping in mind the service it shall provide and the technical constraints the photovoltaic plant is subjected to this Invitation to tender concerns the design, material procurement, construction and commissioning work, and also operation and maintenance for a stationary energy storage power system, PV inverters and PPC included in a general electricity plant, combining storage and photovoltaic panels (PV panels are not in the scope of the Tenderer).

The storage Power plant will be connected to the distribution network at a new 20kV substation as located in the Site layout. The substation will be linked via 20 kV underground network cables to the energy storage plant.
This ITT includes the following items:
ELECTRICAL WORKS (including storage plant).
The Employer’s requirement includes the design, supply, delivery, installation, cabling, connection, testing and commissioning of all electrical Works as follows:

— MV Substation with MV and LV rooms, switchgears, metering, protections, MV/LV auxiliary transformer for the supply of plant auxiliary equipment, grounding and protection equipments and systems deemed necessary,
— Stationary batteries in containers, Battery energy storage system (BESS),
— Battery power conversion system (PCS) which are bidirectional (charge and discharge),
— PV Power conversion system (PCS) which are uni-directional,
— The power plant controller (PPC) for the control of baterry PCS,
— MV/LV transformers connecting MV substation to batteries Power conversion system,
— LV DC electrical network cables with associated termination kits, cable trays and cable protection between the battery containers and battery PCS,
— AC and DC underground electrical network cables (LV and MV) with associated termination kits, cable trays and cable protection between the Battery PCS, MV transformer station and the substation,

— Communication network, including especially optical fiber cables including joints, termination kits, cable trays and cable protection, between Battery containers and battery PCS if needed, and up to the SCADA room in substation,
— Monitoring devices of the storage plant,
— DC network which comprises all electrical equipment between PV module strings to PV inverters. Each circuit consists of DC cables, DC combiner boxes, communication equipment and earth conductors,

— PV Inverter stations which collects the power generated by the PV modules before delivering to the MV substation through the MV AC network. It includes PV inverter(s) (PCS), LV/MV step up transformer, MV switchgear and a building/container/shelter with associated auxiliaries and SCADA equipment,

— MV AC network which comprises several MV AC radial circuits connecting PV Inverter stations to the MV switchyard or the MV/HV substation. Each radial circuit consists of MV underground AC cables, underground FO cables and an earth conductor.
Structural and civil works.
The Employer’s requirement includes design, Material procurement, supply, construction and commissioning works in a safe, orderly and secure way of all the following civil and structural Works:
— Setting out of works,
— All additional investigations needed to perform the work,
— Foundations and walk access,
— Excavation and backfilling of all cable trenches required for the electrical and monitoring underground network cables,
— Grounding system and associated equipment,
— Access track as needed for construction and O&M works,
— Drainage systems required for performance of Works and O&M,
— Topographical survey as shown in the Appendix 2-Drawings,
— Zone clearing and leveling,
— MV Substation foundations and building,
— Storage plant foundations and building,
— All necessary civil works for the implementation of the DC network, PV inverter stations and MV AC.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: Options A for operation and maintenance:
— Option A.1: Year 1 O&M of the storage plant,
— Option A.2: Year 2 O&M of the storage plant,
— Option A.3: Year 3 O&M of the storage plant,
— Option A.4: Year 4 O&M of the storage plant,
— Option A.5: Year 5 O&M of the storage plant,
— Option A.6: Year 6 O&M of the storage plant,
— Option A.7: Year 7 O&M of the storage plant,
— Option A.8: Year 8 O&M of the storage plant,
— Option A.9: Year 9 O&M of the storage plant,
— Option A.10: Year 10 O&M of the storage plant,
— Option A.11: Year 11 O&M of the storage plant,
— Option A.12: Year 12 O&M of the storage plant,
— Option A.13: Year 13 O&M of the storage plant,
— Option A.14: Year 14 O&M of the storage plant,
— Option A.15: Year 15 O&M of the storage plant.
Option B for Energy Management System (EMS), to control and to ensure the best energy efficiency to the whole system, following the production constraints fixed by the grid operator.

SUITABILITY.P: Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met.
The required information shall include as a minimum the following information/documentation:
— Corporate ownership and corporate structure details.
If the company is a subsidiary, the name of the parent company and ultimate parent company must be statedaswell as the name of a French representative, if any
— List of worldwide locations details if any (subsidiaries, affiliates, joint ventures, distributors) specifying thetypeof functionality (service, sales),
— An administration statement stamped and signed by the company that the work will be achieved by regularworkers, according to the laws in effect,

— A sworn statement stamped and signed by the Company stating that the candidate is not in one of the 4situations cited in points 1) to 4) below (full text to be entirely transcribed in the sworn statement):

1) those Candidates who have, within the last five years, been handed down a final sentence forone of the offences provided for in Articles 222-38, 222-40, 226-13, 313-1 to 313-3, 314-1 to 314-3,324-1to324-6,413-9 to 413-12, 421-1 to 421-2-3, subparagraph 2 of Article 421-5, Article 433-1, subparagraph 2 of Article 433-2, subparagraph 8 of Article 434-9, subparagraph 2 of Article 434-9-1, Articles 435-3,435-4,435-9,435-10,441-1 to 441-7, 441-9, 445-1 and 450-1 of the French penal code, Article1741 of the French general tax code and Articles L. 2339-2 to L. 2339-4, L. 2339-11-1 to L. 2339-11-3 of the French defense code and L.317-8 of the French interior security code.

2) those Candidates who have, within the last 5 years, been handed down a sentence listed onReportno 2 of the Criminal records bureau for the offences referred to in Articles L. 8221-1, L. 8221-3,L.8221-5,L.8231-1,L.8241-1, L. 8251-1 and L 8251-2 of the French labour code.

3) those Candidates subject to the compulsory liquidation proceedings provided for in Article L. 640-1 ofthe French commercial code, those individuals whose personal bankruptcy has been pronounced under Article L.653-1 to L. 653-8 of the same Code as well as those persons subject to equivalent proceedings under a foreign law jurisdiction. Candidates admitted to the compulsory reorganization proceedings laid down by Article L. 631-1 of the French Commercial Code or to equivalent proceedings under a foreign law jurisdiction must provide evidence that they have been authorized to continue their activities throughout the foreseeable term of execution of the contract.

4) those Candidates who, on 31 December of the year prior to that during which the tender is launched, had not fulfilled their obligations in terms of tax and social security declarations or had not paid the tax and contributions payable on that date. However, the following shall be regarded as eligible Candidates: those Candidates who, on 31 December of the year prior to that during which the tender is launched, had not paid the various amounts due on that date or provided any guarantees, but who had, before the date of the launch of the tender and without any enforcement measures having been taken by the accountant or the agency responsible for collection, either paid the said amounts or provided guarantees deemed sufficient by the accountant or the agency responsible for collection. Individuals who are legal or de facto directors of a legal entity that does not satisfy the conditions provided for in this subparagraph may not personally tender for a contract.
These conditions are applicable to the Candidates and to each of the members.
These conditions are applicable to the Candidates and to each of the members of a group wishing to tender as a single Candidate.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: All evidences expected are mandatory. If not supplied, the Tenderer application shall not be considered:
— financial statements for the last 3 years,
— financial rating or analysis by a independant agency (Altares, D&B,...),
— if the candidate is owned by a company or a partnership which detains more than 50 % of its shares, the parent company will have to supply all documents testifying its Financial ability.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: The average turnover for the last 3 years should be equivalent or above twice the amount of the considered scope.

LEGAL_FORM.P: Candidates may be either single companies or consortiums.
— A single company, description of qualification and experience of subcontractors (or potential subcontractors) to whom major parts of the services are going to be subcontracted, has to be included,
— A joint venture, the copy of the project of joint venture agreement is required,

— A consortium, a Consortium agreement or the project of Consortium agreement has to be included. The consortium shall be jointly and severally liable (‘conjoint et solidaire’) or with a jointly liable leader (‘mandatairesolidaire’).
A Tenderer, which will submit an offer as member of a consortium or a joint-venture, may not submit an offer as single company or with another consortium or joint-venture.

INFO_ADD.P: EDF Group’s Contract Notices and/or Tenders are published in the EDF Group purchasing portal (GPP). To access it, you have to get registered and to access to the RFx referenced RFx_056045.
Any supplier can register on the Internet page: https://pha.edf.com To register, the supplier has to fill in a questionnaire. Fields followed by — are mandatory.
For EU suppliers, the intra-community VAT number is mandatory.
For suppliers outside European Union, the national identification number (or DUNS number) is mandatory.
For French suppliers (except non-profit organizations), the SIRET number is mandatory.
Suppliers have to enter a main contact. By default, this contact will be registered as the administrator of thesupplier’s record.

As soon as practical after receipt of any request for clarification through the EDF GPP RFx_056045, theEmployer shall respond through the GPP mailbox. Employer's response (including an explanation of therequest but without identifying the source of the enquiry) may be sent, as the case may be, to all prospective Candidates.
If you have any difficulties to access the portal, please contact the helpdes whom will provide technical support. The contact details are on the homepage of the GPP.
